betterquesting:10.desc:8:
As you suspected it is possbible to craft lenses that, added to your Goggles of Revealing, will give it an additional function. A Lens Case will let you conveniently swap out lenses on the go.

To change lenses you'll need to assign a button to the revelant keybind first: Change Lens Focus under Thaumcraft. Hold the button to get a radial menu with the lenses you can equip, press the button while sneaking to take off an equipped lens.

An Echo Lens give you Night Vision underwater (or underlava, or similar). It's of dubious value in a world without oceans monuments or, indeed, any oceans at all. But you might end up on some other planet where it has a chance to shine.

An Evanescent Lens visibly replaces a 3x1x3 area you're looking at with transparent blocks, allowing you see what's behind them. It doesn' work on all blocks and can cause ruinous FPS drops, so if you use it to I.E. look for the End Portal, use it sparingly.

An Illumine Lens gives you Night Vision when not submerged. It has more use cases than its aquatic counterpart.

A Kirlian Lens reveals mobs within a 20-odd block range as either blue circles (living mobs) or red vortexes (undead mobs). Useful for spotting any annoying bats living beneath your base.

A Scholar's Lens automatically scans anything you're looking at, though note that nodes it scans are not automatically added to Node Tracker. Remember to right click a node with a Thaumometer to properly register it after a Scholar's Lens has scanned it.
